page.title: 19CAPEL DOMESDAY SURVEY 1985
page.content: WE FEEL IT MIGHT BE INTERESTING TO RECORD HOW THE CHILDREN AT CAPEL SCHOOL UNDERTOOK THIS SURVEY. FIRST WE FOUND THAT THE AREA WHERE MOST OF THE CHILDREN LIVED WAS IN THE BLOCK TO BE SURVEYED BY PADDOCK WOOD SCHOOL! WE OFFERRED TO DEAL WITH 4 OF THEIR KM. SQUARES INCLUDING FIVE OAK GREEN AND DID THAT FIRST. OUR BLOCK IS LARGELY INACCESSIBLE WATER MEADOW, FARM AND WOODLAND SO THE LAND COVER AND AMENITY COUNTS WERE UNDERTAKEN BY CHILDREN WITH INTREPID PARENTS ONE WEEKEND. ON MONDAY WE COMPARED RESULTS EXCITEDLY. ONE ARDUOUS EXPEDITION TO A SPOT NAMED INTRIGUINGLY{"RATS CASTLE"}ON OUR MAPS PROVED TO BE A DEMOLISHED IRONWORKS!! WE THEN MADE PHONE CALLS, STUDIED DOCUMENTS,ARRANGED INTERVIEWS,VISITED 3 FARMS AND MADE 1 EXTENDED EXPEDITION WE WROTE AND REWROTE TEXT AND THANK YOU LETTERS. {A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE.
